title: Hot Roasted Chestnuts
introduction: Hot roasted chestnuts are a delightful winter treat, perfect for warming up your festive seasons. Traditionally enjoyed on St. Martin's Day in Italy, they bring warmth and a sense of nostalgia as the growing season ends and winter approaches. Their rich, nutty flavor also complements winter holiday meals perfectly.
instructions: Place a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 425Â°F. Rinse the chestnuts and pat them dry. Place the chestnuts flat-side down on a cutting board. Carefully cut an X on the top of each with the tip of a small sharp knife.

Place the chestnuts on a large sheet of heavy-duty aluminum foil. Fold one end over the other to enclose the chestnuts. Fold the ends over to seal. Place the package in a baking pan. Roast the chestnuts until tender when pierced with a small knife, about 45 to 60 minutes.
Transfer the foil package to a cooling rack. Leave the chestnuts wrapped in the foil for 10 minutes. Serve hot.
